job.job_description: Software EngineerFull-timeJob Family Group: Technology and OperationsCompany DescriptionVisa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose â€“ to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.Job DescriptionVisaâ€™s Technology Organization is a community of problem solvers and innovators reshaping the future of commerce. We operate the worldâ€™s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us youâ€™ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms. The Opportunity: We are looking for Versatile, curious, and energetic Software Engineers who embrace solving complex challenges on a global scale. As a Visa Software Engineer, you will be an integral part of a multi-functional development team inventing, designing, building, and testing software products that reach a truly global customer base. While building components of powerful payment technology, you will get to see your efforts shaping the digital future of monetary transactions. The Work itself: Design code and systems that touch 40% of the world population while influencing Visaâ€™s internal standards for scalability, security, and reusability Collaborate multi-functionally to create design artifacts and develop best-in-class software solutions for multiple Visa technical offerings Actively contribute to product quality improvements, valuable service technology, and new business flows in diverse agile squads Develop robust and scalable products intended for a myriad of customers including end-user merchants, b2b, and business to government solutions. Leverage innovative technologies to build the next generation of Payment Services, Transaction Platforms, Real-Time Payments, and Buy Now Pay Later Technology Opportunities to make a difference on a global or local scale through mentorship and continued learning opportunities Essential Functions:Demonstrates basic knowledge and asks questions about project requirements.Reviews and asks questions about solution strategies that improve the design and functionality of a payment product feature.Applies standard processes on the use of front-end programming languages (e.g. HTML, C++, Java) to write code that fulfills website modification requests and technical requirements, under close guidance.Works under close guidance from others to support the piloting of new technology capabilities and features that enhance the user website experience across e-commerce products.Identifies and advances bugs that threaten website functionality Job Description and Responsibilitiesâ€¢ Write needs. â€¢ Work closely with multiple stakeholders in a cross-functional organization within an Agile environment. â€¢ Responsible for agile end-to-end development process within the construct of DevOps practices and methodology. â€¢ Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies, support agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint review, and sprint retrospective. â€¢ performance and security within WebView. â€¢ Perform quality assurance testing, including unit, systems, integration, and regression testing, and support the development of automated test scripts to be used to automate regression testing. â€¢ The position reports to the Employerâ€™s Austin, Texas office and may allow for partial telecommuting. job.job_title: Junior Technical Analyst (AI, Automation & IT Operations)
job.job_description:
Corner Alliance is a dynamic, growing consulting firm devoted to delivering meaningful results for the federal government through innovation, emerging technology, and mission-driven expertise. We believe a company is only as good as its people â€“ if you are a self-starter, passionate about your work, and enjoy solving complex problems, we want to meet you.Â 

**About the Role:**Â 

We are seeking a **Junior Technical Analyst** with strong analytical ability, a growth mindset, and a desire to learn AI/automation, IT operations, and compliance practices. This is an early-career position designed to support federal contracts, internal IT operations, system compliance, and audit-ready documentation.Â 

**Key Responsibilities include *(but are not limited to)*:**Â Â 

-   Learn and apply AI/ML, automation, and no-code tools to support federal contract deliverables and internal process improvements.

-   Assist in prototyping technical solutions: automated workflows, data pipelines, chatbots, dashboards, and internal productivity tools.Â 

-   Support device management, user onboarding/offboarding, account and license management, and general IT support (hardware, software, access issues).Â 

-   Help maintain inventories of equipment, software licenses, and system configurations.Â 

-   Support documentation of IT policies, procedures, controls; help track compliance with federal standards (e.g., NIST, CMMC, agency-specific requirements).Â 

-   Help collect and prepare documentation, evidence, and audit artifacts; assist in internal and external audit preparation, compliance reviews, and follow-up actions.Â 

-   Support data analysis tasks: basic data cleaning, exploration, dashboard creation using spreadsheets, SQL, Python or no-code tools (training provided).Â 

-   Assist with project support: documentation, task tracking, Agile workflow coordination, cross-team collaboration, and knowledge management.Â 

-   Help produce deliverables for federal clients: process maps, technical analysis, reports, workflow diagrams, and presentation materials.Â 

-   Carry out our Commitments to Deliver, Grow, and ThriveÂ 

**Required Experience/Skills:**Â Â 

-   Bachelorâ€™s degree in a technical, analytical, cyber, or business-related field, or equivalent experience.â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

-   1â€“3 years of experience in IT support, technical analysis, compliance support, data analysis, government contracting, or related fields. Â 

-   Basic scripting or programming (e.g., Python, SQL, PowerShell, Bash). Â 

-   Exposure and ability to use automation or AI tools, RPA platforms, or no-code automation builders.Â 

-   Strong communication, coordination, documentation, and problem-solving skills.Â 

-   Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a small-team, fast-paced environment.Â 

-   US citizenship or permanent resident.Â 

**Preferred Experience/Skills:**Â 

-   Familiarity with compliance frameworks (e.g., NIST, CMMC, federal security standards), or willingness to learn.Â 

-   Experience with IT admin tools (account management, identity management, MDM, cloud platforms).Â 

-   Prior experience in consulting, government contracting, or customer-facing support roles.Â 

**Location:**Â 

You will work as part of a dynamic team remotely. U.S. only and must reside in one of the following states: AL, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FL, GA, IL, IN, IA, KY, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WIÂ 

*Donâ€™t think you have everything for this role but are still very interested? Please donâ€™t hold back from applying because you may not have it all. You can learn and grow with us. We're looking for someone who is coachable, unflappable in navigating challenges, resourceful in learning new skills, innovative in challenging the status quo, excellent in writing, analytical in thinking, skilled in prioritization, and a rapport builder with clients and colleagues.*Â 

***About Us:***Â

job.description:
Corner Alliance is a dynamic, growing consulting firm devoted to delivering meaningful results for the federal government through innovation, emerging technology, and mission-driven expertise. We believe a company is only as good as its people â€“ if you are a self-starter, passionate about your work, and enjoy solving complex problems, we want to meet you.Â 

**About the Role:**Â 

We are seeking a **Junior Technical Analyst** with strong analytical ability, a growth mindset, and a desire to learn AI/automation, IT operations, and compliance practices. This is an early-career position designed to support federal contracts, internal IT operations, system compliance, and audit-ready documentation.Â 

**Key Responsibilities include *(but are not limited to)*:**Â Â 

-   Learn and apply AI/ML, automation, and no-code tools to support federal contract deliverables and internal process improvements.

-   Assist in prototyping technical solutions: automated workflows, data pipelines, chatbots, dashboards, and internal productivity tools.Â 

-   Support device management, user onboarding/offboarding, account and license management, and general IT support (hardware, software, access issues).Â 

-   Help maintain inventories of equipment, software licenses, and system configurations.Â 

-   Support documentation of IT policies, procedures, controls; help track compliance with federal standards (e.g., NIST, CMMC, agency-specific requirements).Â 

-   Help collect and prepare documentation, evidence, and audit artifacts; assist in internal and external audit preparation, compliance reviews, and follow-up actions.Â 

-   Support data analysis tasks: basic data cleaning, exploration, dashboard creation using spreadsheets, SQL, Python or no-code tools (training provided).Â 

-   Assist with project support: documentation, task tracking, Agile workflow coordination, cross-team collaboration, and knowledge management.Â 

-   Help produce deliverables for federal clients: process maps, technical analysis, reports, workflow diagrams, and presentation materials.Â 

-   Carry out our Commitments to Deliver, Grow, and ThriveÂ

-   Basic scripting or programming (e.g., Python, SQL, PowerShell, Bash). Â 

-   Exposure and ability to use automation or AI tools, RPA platforms, or no-code automation builders.Â 

-   Strong communication, coordination, documentation, and problem-solving skills.Â 

-   Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a small-team, fast-paced environment.Â 

-   US citizenship or permanent resident.Â

-   Prior experience in consulting, government contracting, or customer-facing support roles.Â

job.job_title: Associate Software Development Engineer in Test
job.job_description: Position Overview We are looking for a passionate and detail-oriented Associate Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our DevOps, Tools & Automation team. This entry-level role is ideal for someone eager to grow in the field of test automation and software development, with a strong focus on Python-based development.You will help design, implement, and maintain automated test frameworks and tools that ensure the reliability and performance of our software systems. ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain automated test scripts using Python for backend services, APIs, and web applications.Build reusable Python modules and utilities to support test automation.Collaborate with developers, QA engineers, and DevOps to integrate automated testing into Jenkins pipelines.Execute test plans, analyze results, and report defects with clear documentation.Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving test coverage and reliability.Required Interpersonal Skills & BehaviorsProblem-solving skillsAnalytical and critical thinkingStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work independently or collaboratively within a team environmentRequired Skills and CompetenciesSome programming experience (Python preferred)Education and ExperienceAssociateâ€™s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related field0-2 years hands on experience in software development or functional and non-functional testing Additional InformationThe position is hybrid at our facility in Acton, MA.Travel is estimated at 5% but will flex depending on business needs. NOTE: This position is eligible for hybrid working arrangements (requires on-site work from our Acton, MA office; may work remotely other days). #LI-HybridAdditional Information: Compensation & Benefits: For U.S.-based positions only, the annual base salary range for this role is $79,725.00 - $119,587.50 This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including: â€¢ Medical, dental, and vision insurance â€¢ 401(k) with company match â€¢ Paid time off (PTO) â€¢ And additional employee wellness programs Application Details: This job posting will remain open until the position is filled. To apply, please visit the Insulet Careers site and submit your application online. Actual pay depends on skills, experience, and education.Insulet Corporation (NASDAQ: PODD), headquartered in Massachusetts, is an innovative medical device company dedicated to simplifying life for people with diabetes and other conditions through its Omnipod product platform. The Omnipod Insulin Management System provides a unique alternative to traditional insulin delivery methods. With its simple, wearable design, the tubeless disposable Pod provides up to three days of non-stop insulin delivery, without the need to see or handle a needle. Insuletâ€™s flagship innovation, the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System, integrates with a continuous glucose monitor to manage blood sugar with no multiple daily injections, zero fingersticks, and can be controlled by a compatible personal smartphone in the U.S. or by the Omnipod 5 Controller. Insulet also leverages the unique design of its Pod by tailoring its Omnipod technology platform for the delivery of non-insulin subcutaneous drugs across other therapeutic areas. For more information, please visit insulet.com and omnipod.com.We are looking for highly motivated, performance-driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!At Insulet Corporation all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.(Know Your Rights)

job.job_description: Data Engineer, JuniorThe Opportunity: Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that thereâ€™s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing data can yield pivotal insights when itâ€™s gathered from disparate sources. We need a data professional like you to help our clients find answers in their data to impact important missions from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence.As a data engineer at Booz Allen, youâ€™ll use your skills to help build advanced technology solutions and implement data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. Youâ€™ll help develop and deploy the pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful. Here, youâ€™ll learn from a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. Youâ€™ll grow your skills in analytical exploration and data examination while you support the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. Work with us to use data for good.Join us. The world canâ€™t wait. You Have:Experience with data engineering concepts, including data collection, storage, processing, cleaning, or transformingKnowledge of AWS cloud services, Azure, Google, or AWS cloudKnowledge of search indexesAbility to obtain a Top Secret clearanceScheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree by Summer 2026 or Winter 2026Nice If You Have:Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph examAWS Cloud CertificationsClearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allenâ€™s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individualâ€™s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $48,000.00 to $98,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allenâ€™s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.Identity StatementAs part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, youâ€™ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, youâ€™ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.Commitment to Non-DiscriminationAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

job.job_description: Software Engineer - New Grad At Sentra we embarked on an exciting journey to build a one-of-a-kind company memory to help growing startups overcome scaling challenges. At Sentra , we've developed a true AI teammate that understands an organization's context, goals, and culture - offering both ICs and leaders unprecedented transparency into what's happening across the company and strategic alignment. Sentra is backed by a16z and Together Fund , working with leaders from the top tech companies in the valley. Our goal? To never let a company lose itself as it gets bigger. job.job_description: Software Quality Assurance Engineer IFolsom, CASoftware Engineering â€“ Software Engineering /Full-Time /HybridApply for this jobJob DescriptionThe Quality Assurance Engineer I works under the guidance of a Quality Assurance Group Manager to develop and execute tests against all aspects of Ignition. They are responsible for developing, maintaining and executing automated and manual tests, and for reporting on the progress and status of test activities. This includes validating and verifying new and improved features with a variety of testing tools and approaches, including both automated and manual execution within multiple applications (desktop, front-end (Web), back-end (API), and mobile). Additionally, the Quality Assurance Engineer I will be directly involved in building and testing production versions of the system. This is a full-time position with hybrid and on-site opportunities available.For those coming into the position with no Quality Assurance experience but with a CS/CE background, this role provides a different opportunity to leverage oneâ€™s technical aptitude. The role primarily involves a comprehensive and end-user focused approach to interacting with the software via testing, while still utilizing certain programming skills for automation test development and issue debugging.Responsibilities:Validating low complexity issues (both bugs and features), adding test coverage where appropriateContributing to automated test cases at an introductory level (i.e., small fixes and enhancements to existing tests)Participating in testing contributions within the development lifecycle including: validating bug fixes, conduct regression testing, and automation test case developmentConsistently meeting target threshold for regression test suite execution; add manual test cases where appropriate with guidance from Senior Quality AssuranceDeveloping and executing test plans that cover all functional requirements, receiving consultation as needed for other applicable areasDemonstrating sufficient proficiency in multiple Ignition product areas within the team's scope and adequately test those areasDemonstrating autonomy by maintaining progress on assigned tasks and leveraging resources effectivelyCollaborating with the team and department, working with development to better understand features and provide feedback about functionality, as well as effectively using senior resources to improve personal technical skillsWorking to maintain a proficient understanding of the company, our customer base, our software (Ignition) and its purposeDocumenting and tracking defects using issue tracking tools, ensuring timely resolutionStaying up to date with industry trends and best practices in software testingDemonstrating a strong inquisitive nature and attention to detail, especially in identifying or debugging defectsRequirements:Education and Training:Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field1 year of industry experience preferred not requiredSkills:Proficiency with at least one well-known programming language (Java, Python, JavaScript)Good understanding of the SDLC (Software Development Lifecycle) and each of the phasesExperience interacting with and querying SQL databases (MS SQL Server, MySQL, similar)Preferred, but not required:Familiarity with Scrum/Agile frameworks and key concepts (core values of Agile, sprints, planning/retrospective meetings)Familiarity with Windows, conflicts)Familiarity with using virtualization software (VMWare, Docker Desktop), tasks like creating images, debugging running containers, and use of persistent data (volumes)Experience with modern IDEs (Eclipse, IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm)$95,000 - $105,000 a yearPayBased on the Sacramento region, the new hires minimum and maximum target salary for this role is $95k - $105k. job.job_description: You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members by using technology to improve health outcomes around the world. As a diversified, national organization, Centene's technology professionals have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility. Position Purpose: Develops and operationalizes data pipelines to make data available for consumption (reports and advanced analytics). job.job_description: Who We Are GoodShip is the first all-in-one platform for freight orchestration and procurement. Our innovative software helps shippers optimize their truckload freight spend and service outcomes while enhancing collaboration among internal teams and carrier partners. The US domestic truckload freight market is massive â€“ the industry generated revenues of $941 billion across 11.46 billion tons of product shipped in 2022. Our technology is optimizing freight outcomes for our customers, a rapidly growing roster which includes some of the industryâ€™s largest and most recognizable brands. Our software automates previously tedious and resource-intensive tasks, and unites disparate data sources to provide a holistic view of network performance. We provide shippers with best-in-class intelligence, a purpose-built procurement workflow, and the tools to collaborate more effectively and initiate corrective action directly within the GoodShip platform. Weâ€™re backed by A-list venture firms and founders of industry-leading FreightTech companies, and were recently recognized in the FreightWaves FreightTech 25 and the BCV x Headline Vertical SaaS 50. With ample financial backing and strong traction, weâ€™re seeking a talented Platform Data Analyst to join us on the ground floor and help bring ultra-modern transportation technology to market. About the Role At GoodShip, data integrity is a core pillar of our platformâ€”our customers depend on accurate, timely, and trustworthy data to run their supply chains. As a Platform Data Analyst, youâ€™ll play a critical role in upholding that standard by partnering with engineers and technical product managers to build, validate, and troubleshoot the data pipelines that power both internal workflows and external customer-facing metrics. This is a foundational role in building out a high-trust, high-impact data function at GoodShip. Youâ€™ll be part of the team responsible for ensuring the metrics we share with customers are accurate, meaningful, and explainable. Embedded within the engineering organization, youâ€™ll work closely with both engineers and product managers to scale data integrity and visibility across the company. The role may also involve occasional customer interactions to troubleshoot issues or refine metric definitions. You Will Define, implement, and maintain core customer-facing metrics that are accurate, well-documented, and resilient to change Investigate data quality concerns, pipeline issues, and metric discrepancies, partnering with engineering to identify root causes and resolve them Analyze and transform large datasets to generate insights and create foundational tables that support both internal tooling and customer-facing experiences Develop and maintain data validation, monitoring, and quality-assurance processes to ensure consistency and completeness across the platform Collaborate cross-functionally with engineers, technical product managers, and customer-facing teams to understand and translate data requirements Build internal documentation, queries, and lightweight tooling that enable others at GoodShip to confidently use and trust platform data The Ideal Candidate Strong SQL fluency, including experience with complex joins, CTEs, and window functions Proficiency with Excel and modern analytics or BI tools (e.g., dbt, Metabase, or similar) Experience with data quality, validation frameworks, or data observability tooling Comfort defining metrics and clearly articulating how they are calculated and interpreted Strong analytical mindset and experience working closely with engineers in a sprint-based development environment Excellent written communication skills, particularly when explaining data logic to non-technical audiences Benefits Competitive salary and meaningful equity in GoodShip 100% employer-paid health benefits Unlimited PTO Winter break during the December holidays Fully remote work environment Destination team off-sites
